intro: Hackelia stewartii, commonly known as Stewart's bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes, preferring well-drained soils. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are arranged in dense, terminal clusters. Hackelia stewartii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also of interest in ecological studies due to its role in supporting pollinators.
